intro: Clypeola psilocarpa, commonly known as the red-spored earthstar, is a unique species of fungi belonging to the family Geastraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruiting body that emerges from the soil, often in moist, shaded environments. The cap of the fungus is covered in a layer of spores that appear reddish in color, giving it its common name. It typically grows in temperate regions and is often found in association with decaying organic matter. This species is notable for its ecological role in decomposing plant material and recycling nutrients in forest ecosystems.
